Help:Node.title: General Concepts: Memory
Help:Node.Log:Description:
Title: Memory
Important Commands: forget, recall, remember
Your character can remember things. This helps to make sure that you have all in-game information at your fingertips whenever you play--without having scattered scraps of papers and notes sitting on your desktop.
To make a permanent note of something, use the $(udat.chatchar)REMEMBER command with the information you want to remember in quotes: $(udat.chatchar)REMEMBER "The poet made fun of me in a poem".
To recall something you've remembered, type $(udat.chatchar)RECALL [PHRASE]", where the phrase should be a word or a set of quoted words that appear in the memory: $(udat.chatchar)RECALL Poet or $(udat.chatchar)RECALL "The Poet". If you recall a number of memories, they will currently show up in the order that they were memorized.
You might find it helpful to use a specific format for your memories, such as "Quest: Find the Queen's handkerchief" or "People: Poet: Made fun of me". This way you can recall your keywords (like "Quest" or "People" or "Poet"), and know you're accessing all of the information on that topic.
You can forget memories by typing $(udat.chatchar)FORGET [PHRASE], where the phrase should be a word or a set of quoted words. You'll forget all memories that include that word or words.
